chunks.cleaned_english_translation: Against the statement: everything exists from the Father through the Son in the Holy Spirit. Listen carefully, because you'll find it said that everything was made not only from the Father, but also from the Son and the Holy Spirit. In the Letter to the Ephesians, the Apostle speaks about the Son: "But speaking the truth in love, let us grow in every way into him who is the head, Christ, from whom the whole body is joined and held together." Consider this about the Son: now listen about the Holy Spirit: "Unless one is born of water and the Holy Spirit, he cannot see the kingdom of God." And once more, it's written in the Gospel: "So it is with everyone who is born of the Spirit."
chunks.original_latin:
Contra id quod dicunt: ex Patre per Filium in
Spiritu sancto esse omnia. Audi quia non solum ex
Patre, sed et ex Filio, et Spiritu sancto facta omnia
invenies dictum. Apostolus ad Ephesios sic dicit de
Filio: Veritatem autem facientes in caritate augeamur
in illo per omnia, qui est caput Christus, ex quo totum
corpus connexum et compactum. Ecce ex Filio: audi
 et ex Spiritu sancto: Si quis non renatus fuerit ex
aqua et Spiritu sancto, non potest videre regnum Dei. Et iterum in Evangelio legitur: Sic est omnis qui
natus est ex Spiritu.
